thread.title: What EXACTLY did the Spice Girls mean when they sang 'Zig-A-Zig-Ah'? We'll never know - and it's all Katy Perry's fault
thread.title_full: What EXACTLY did the Spice Girls mean when they sang 'Zig-A-Zig-Ah'? We'll never know - and it's all Katy Perry's fault

author: Vicki Newman
title: What EXACTLY did the Spice Girls mean when they sang 'Zig-A-Zig-Ah'? We'll never know - and it's all Katy Perry's fault
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It's a moment some of us have been waiting 20 years for - to find out exactly what the Spice Girls meant when they sang 'I really really really wanna Zig-A-Zig-Ah'. 
But now we'll never know, and it's all thanks to Katy Perry . 
The singing star joined Jamie Theakston and Emma Bunton on their Heart Breakfast show on Wednesday and wouldn't let Baby Spice get a word in edgeways when she was trying to spill the beans on the pop secret. Read More Katy Perry stuns at London Fashion Week after chopping her hair into short platinum bob Katy asked what the lyrics meant ... but we never really found out 
Of course, we've all made our own assumptions about what the phrase means, but someone in the know was about to reveal the truth after all these years and just never got the chance. 
The presenting duo decided to test Katy on her song lyric knowledge, playing snippets of famous hits and asking her to fill in the blanks. 
When Jamie played the Spice Girls' 1996 hit Wannabe, Katy guessed the lyrics correctly, but then shouted: "What does it mean?" You really really really wanna what? 
Emma begins to reveal the phrase's true meaning, saying: "It means ... it's rude ... well it kind of means..." 
But Katy jumps in: "Is it rude for us to talk over you or are you just saying?" 
Emma replies: "No, it can mean anything you want it to mean but we all kind of, when we..." Katy was on Emma and Jamie's radio show 
But Katy, who is in London for the Brit Awards, cuts her off again, saying: "You've had media training on this for a few years, 'It can mean whatever you want, it's your interpretation'." 
Emma laughs before appearing to give up on her explanation, saying: "But it's rude." 
A shocked Katy then asks: "It is really?" She's in London for the Brits 
Wouldn't we like to know! Our assumptions will have to satisfy us for now. 
Mirror Celeb has reached out to Emma to find out once and for all what 'Zig-A-Zig-Ah' means. 
We've also asked Katy's representatives for comment. 
* Tune in to Jamie and Emma on Heart London Breakfast, Mon-Fri 6am-9am Like us on Facebook
